sections.heading: Compound Verb Formation
sections.content:
Compound verbs (複合動詞 - fukugou doushi) are created by combining two verbs to express a single, more specific action. The first verb (in stem form) provides the main action, while the second verb adds nuance about manner, direction, or aspect.

Structure: Verb 1 (stem) + Verb 2 (conjugated) Example: 飲み (drink stem) + 始める (begin) = 飲み始める "begin drinking" First verb = main action Second verb = adds meaning

children.heading: Using verb stems
children.content: Step 1: Get the stem of first verb 食べる → 食べ (tabe) 読む → 読み (yomi) 書く → 書き (kaki) Step 2: Add second verb 食べ + 始める = 食べ始める "start eating" 読み + 終わる = 読み終わる "finish reading" 書き + 続ける = 書き続ける "continue writing" Stem formation: る-verbs: Drop る う-verbs: Change to い-form

children.heading: Combined meaning
children.content: The compound creates a single concept: 飲み始める Not: "drink" and "begin" separately But: "begin drinking" as one action 書き終わる Not: "write" and "finish" But: "finish writing" as complete idea Treated as one verb Conjugates as the second verb

children.heading: Aspectual verbs
children.content: These add information about how/when action occurs: 始める - begin 終わる - finish 続ける - continue 出す - start suddenly 直す - redo かける - be in the middle of

children.heading: Directional verbs
children.content: These show direction of action: 上がる - go up 下がる - go down 入る - enter 出る - exit

children.heading: Result verbs
children.content: These show completion or result: 切る - completely 抜く - thoroughly 込む - into something

children.heading: る-verbs
children.content: 食べる → 食べ 見る → 見 寝る → 寝 起きる → 起き Simply drop る Easy pattern

children.heading: う-verbs
children.content: 飲む → 飲み (nomu → nomi) 読む → 読み (yomu → yomi) 書く → 書き (kaku → kaki) 話す → 話し (hanasu → hanashi) 待つ → 待ち (matsu → machi) Change to い-form Same as ます form without ます

children.heading: Irregular
children.content: する → し 来る (くる) → 来 (き) 勉強する → 勉強し 勉強し始める "start studying"

children.heading: The compound conjugates as the second verb
children.content: 飲み始める (ru-verb): Present: 飲み始める Past: 飲み始めた Negative: 飲み始めない Te-form: 飲み始めて 書き続ける (ru-verb): Present: 書き続ける Past: 書き続けた Negative: 書き続けない Te-form: 書き続けて Only second verb changes First verb stays in stem

children.heading: Follows second verb
children.content: If second verb is transitive, compound is transitive: 読み始める (始める is transitive) 本を読み始める "start reading a book" If second verb is intransitive, compound is intransitive: 降り出す (出す here becomes intransitive) 雨が降り出した "rain started falling" Second verb determines grammar

children.heading: Can stack sometimes
children.content: Less common but possible: 読み始めている "be in the state of having started reading" 書き続けていた "was continuing to write" Adding ている to compounds Shows ongoing state

children.heading: Natural vs unnatural
children.content: Natural: 食べ始める ✓ 飲み続ける ✓ 書き終わる ✓ Unnatural: 食べ上がる ✗ (doesn't make semantic sense) 飲み入る ✗ (illogical combination) Must make logical sense Some combinations established Others don't exist

children.heading: First verb must be compatible
children.content: The action of verb 1 must be something that can: - Begin (始める) - Continue (続ける) - Finish (終わる) - Be done excessively (すぎる) etc. 走り始める ✓ "start running" - running can begin 走り忘れる ✗ "forget to run" - use 走るのを忘れる instead

children.heading: Usually written together
children.content: 一緒に書く: 飲み始める (not 飲み 始める) 食べ続ける (not 食べ 続ける) Written as one unit No space between Single compound verb

children.heading: Same in both registers
children.content: Compound verbs used equally in: - Casual speech - Formal speech - Writing The formality comes from: - Conjugation (です/ます vs plain) - Context - Other grammar Not inherently formal or casual

children.heading: Start with common patterns
children.content: Most useful second verbs: 始める, 終わる, 続ける, 出す, 直す, すぎる Learn these combinations first Understand the pattern Gradually expand Focus on natural, common compounds Don't try to force unnatural ones

children.heading: Compare structures
children.content: Compound: 食べ始める "begin eating" - single unified action Separate: 食べるのを始める "begin the eating" - more explicit Compound = more natural, concise Separate = more formal, explicit Both grammatically correct

sections.heading: Common Mistakes
sections.content: ❌ Using dictionary form of first verb ✗ 食べる始める ✓ Using stem form ✓ 食べ始める ❌ Wrong stem form ✗ 飲む始める (should be 飲み) ✓ Correct stem ✓ 飲み始める ❌ Conjugating first verb ✗ 食べた続ける ✓ First verb stays in stem ✓ 食べ続けた Stem form is key Only second verb conjugates
